name: Amphiphile
details: Compound with both hydrophilic and hydrophobic groups. e.g. sufactant, detergent, phospholipid

name: Antibiotic
details: Substance which inhibits the growth of a micro-organism

name: Buffer
details: System which can neutalise effects of addition of acids and bases

name: Buffering Agent
details: The weak acid or weak base that would comprise a Buffer or Buffer Solution

name: Chromatography
details: Reagent for use in chromatography experiments

name: Competent cells
details: Cell or cells capable of DNA uptake

name: Culture media
details: Liquid or solid substance used for the growth of cells

name: Detergent
details: Substance with polar (water soluble) and non-polar(hydrophobic) domains

name: Electrophoresis
details: Reagent for use in electrophoresis experiments

name: Enzyme -modifying
details: Modifying enzyme e.g. kinase, phosphatase, etc.

name: Enzyme -polymerase
details: Polymerase enzyme e.g. Taq, Pfu, Reverse transcriptase, etc.

name: Forward Primer
details: Used in combination with a Reverse Primer in PCR

name: Heavy atom reagent
details: Reagent used for preparing heavy-atom derivatives of protein crystals

name: Inhibitor
details: Substance which inhibits the activity of a molecule

name: Lipid
details: Hydrocarbon containing organic compound, insoluble in water

name: Nucleic acid purification kit
details: Commercial kit for nucleic acid purification"

name: Nucleic acid modification kit
details: Commercial kit for modifying nucleic acids"

name: Nucleotide
details: Nucleotide compounds and solutions e.g.dATP, NADP, etc.

name: Purified protein
details: Purified protein, ready for crystallogenesis or further analysis

name: Radiochemical
details: Chemical prepared using a radioactive element

name: Reverse Primer
details: Used in combination with a Forward Primer in PCR

name: Substrate
details: Substance acted on by an enzyme

name: Transformed cells
details: Cell or cells which have been modified to contain foreign DNA such as a plasmid: e.g. E.coli transformed with pDEST17

name: TrialDrop
details: A drop on a crystallogenesis plate
